Articles.Content:
I have a small question about mods, like I almost run 30 mods and almost all gamefiles are modified, getting at least 1 crash a day. Since KSP 64 is soup-ier than the default aerodynamics model I am forced to play on KSP 32 bit, but does this have a mod limit? If so when do I know I hit this limit. Or when will it cost game stability?

And 64 bit, I have come to believe you can have almost infinite mods as long as you have enough memory.

Thanks in advance
you know ypu've hit your limit when you have a crash on 32 bit

Check your memory usage after you load up, while in editor, and in flight. Keep it as low as possible. Once you hit somewhere near 4gb, you are going to crash/freeze (depending on machines, some can actually be much lower than 4, like 3.5). I am running about 60-70 mods, and I am at around 3GB in normal operation (running in open GL + aggressive texture management + DDSLoader with most textures converted to dds and resized down to 3/4 or 1/2 for really intensive ones) once I hit 3.7 I will crash.
No kerbal yet has anime hair and eyes so far and is dressed like a little schoolgirl, so I'm gonna say "no"

memory usage will usually get you long before any other instabilities creep in from modding. i've had some weirdness and crashes that i've tracked back to mods, but overall i tend to spend 30 minutes memory-managing my GameData for every 1 minute i spend investigating other crashes.

No kerbal yet has anime hair and eyes so far and is dressed like a little schoolgirl, so I'm gonna say "no"

Careful for what you wish for.

P.S. I've seen a animu eyed Kerbals before.
Considering that several mods have shaped the stock game in significant ways I would say that mods have not gone far enough....
You should probably install ActiveTextureManagement. It will (hopefully) prevent those crashes.

I haven't seen a hot coffee mod yet, so I'd say no.

Mods haven't gone too far until you hit memory limit.

Excellent misleading title.

Word. I was expecting some moderator bashing.
Taking Skyrim as example: It's still pritty tame actually
